chunks.title: Exercise 3 - Solution  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #32.mp4

text: You guys did a great job in exercise 3 A lot of people have solved exercise 3 And I'm really very proud of you that you guys are learning so much In today's video, you'll get a shoutout And I'm going to react to your solutions in this video So that your understanding of CSS can improve Like the video with high energy and write Sigma Batch OP in the comment section below Let's go to the computer screen Let's roll the intro Alright guys, I'm back in my computer screen I'm going to give you guys a shoutout A lot of people have used different ways to solve this exercise And I'm really very proud of you guys You guys have used a lot of great ways Now what I'm going to do is I have made an index.html file here And in this index.html, I'm going to design my card And I'm going to simply put a div.card in the body And after putting the card, I'm going to put a style And after putting the style, I'm going to give some styles to this card And here I'm going to simply put a background color in my body I'm going to put a background color of grey I've put a background color of grey And I'm going to put a background color of white in the card So that it looks different And along with that, I'm going to give a width and height I'm going to give a width of 344 pixels And I'm going to give a height of 444 pixels This is how my card looks I've written it in pixels Now I'm going to make it 144 pixels I'm going to make it 344 pixels Here 244 pixels also looks good I just have to design my card That's it And now you can reach the width and height of an ideal card with
